intro: Spergula arvensis f. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple false oatgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a variant of Spergula arvensis, characterized by its distinctive purplish hue in the inflorescence and leaves. This perennial herb typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and agricultural fields. The plant has a slender stem and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
